entry.title: Combined summary - RGB / Mimblewhimble: modularity of underlying ZK schemes
entry.summary: The writer is curious about the modularity of the zero-knowledge (ZK) schemes used for privacy on RGB and whether documentation exists on switching to quantum-resistant alternatives from Bulletproofs. They also ask about the design rationale for cryptographic primitives in the Bitcoin ecosystem and whether ZK-Starks could be a viable alternative. The writer expresses uncertainty regarding important criteria for RGB use cases, including proof time, verification time, proof size, quantum resistance, and communication complexity. They are intrigued by the choice of Bulletproofs and seek more information. The writer wonders if anyone has experimented with using ZK-Starks for RGB use cases.
